metadata.description: Modern Smart Research and Guidance System

hero.title: MAARS
hero.subtitle: Modern Smart Research and Guidance System
hero.description: MAARS is a working framework that aims to produce measurement, analysis, and guidance in health and society using artificial intelligence and data-driven methods. The goal is to simplify complex problems, support sound decisions, and develop applicable models.

about.title: What is MAARS?
about.description1: MAARS (Modern Smart Research and Guidance System) is an interdisciplinary approach. At the intersection of health, artificial intelligence, and public policy; it transforms data collection, evaluation, classification, and decision support processes into a systematic structure.
about.description2: MAARS is not a "single project"; it is an overarching architecture that unifies different projects and field applications under the same methodological language.
about.keyMessage: MAARS is a methodological and system architecture that aims to transfer the experience gained from completed projects (e.g., iShe) to new programs and pilot applications.

whatWeDo.title: What Does MAARS Do?
whatWeDo.intro: The core function of MAARS is to transform data into "knowledge" and "guidance."

measure.title: Measures
measure.description: Uses a structured measurement approach to identify needs, risks, and priorities.

analyze.title: Analyzes
analyze.description: Converts collected data into meaningful indicators; enables comparison and monitoring.

guide.title: Produces Guidance
guide.description: Develops applicable recommendation frameworks at individual, institutional, and societal levels.

model.title: Designs Models
model.description: Produces field-appropriate models and roadmaps that can be tested through pilot applications.

ishe.title: Project iShe
ishe.description: iShe is a study conducted and completed under TÜBİTAK. Under the MAARS umbrella, it stands as a reference project demonstrating the field application of the measurement and guidance approach.

terakki.title: Project Terakki
terakki.description: Community-based development; produces guidance in education, awareness, and capacity building.

muasir.title: Project Muasır
muasir.description: Contemporary system reading: produces frameworks on topics such as technology, ethics, governance, and public design.

istanbul.title: Urban Health Reform
istanbul.description: Aims to design a holistic health model focused on local government at Istanbul scale.

izmir.title: Living Campuses
izmir.description: Aims to develop a living campus model focused on active aging and elderly health with the "Third Age University" approach in Izmir.

yozgat.title: National AI Initiative
yozgat.description: Strategic action plan and ministry establishment roadmap study with the goal of AI leadership.

team.title: Academic Working Group
team.subtitle: MAARS Laboratory
team.description: The MAARS Academic Working Group is an interdisciplinary research team working primarily on artificial intelligence systems and application models.

human.title: Human-Centered
human.description: Output must produce value for human life.

modular.title: Modular
modular.description: System expands without breaking down as projects grow.

ethics.title: Ethical Sensitivity
ethics.description: The goal is proper use, not technology.

q1.question: Is MAARS an institution or a project?
q1.answer: MAARS is an overarching system approach that unifies multiple projects and programs under the same methodological framework.

q2.question: What are iShe / Terakki / Muasır?
q2.answer: They are core modules of MAARS. Each focuses on a different need and provides "methodology" support to field programs.

q3.question: Is iShe finished?
q3.answer: Yes. iShe is a project conducted and completed under TÜBİTAK. It exists within MAARS as a "completed reference study" and provides methodological foundation for new programs.

q4.question: What do field programs mean?
q4.answer: They are pilot/implementation areas for applying the MAARS approach in different cities and scenarios.

q5.question: Who do you collaborate with?
q5.answer: Pilot studies and research partnerships are targeted with academic institutions, local governments, health institutions, and technology teams.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: MAARS is a living system that develops through pilot applications and research collaborations. You can contact us for institutional collaborations and joint projects.
